content: The facility being established by the GMR Group in an extent of 136 acres provided by the MANSAS Trust free of cost will position India not only as a large aviation market but also as a global supplier of aviation talent and innovation, he asserts

title: Joint enforcement operation targets pubs, bars ahead of New Year celebrations
content: In the wake of the Goa pub fire tragedy, multiple departments have launched a joint operation for the first time in the city to crack down on pubs, bars, and restaurants that are violating norms and lacking basic infrastructure

title: LDF takes comfort in vote share numbers in Thiruvananthapuram Corporation
content: According to a tweet by John Brittas, the BJP‚Äôs vote share went down from 2,13,214 votes in the 2024 LS polls to 1,65,891 in the 2025 local body polls and UDF's from 1,84,727 to 1,25,984 votes. LDF‚Äôs vote share increased from 1,29,048 to 1,67,522 votes

title: "Every Australian Wanted To Do": Angry Man Stomps On Bondi Shooter's Head
content: An Australian bystander who stomped on the head of one of the men accused in the Bondi Beach mass shooting has said he feels no remorse for his actions, describing them as an instinctive response to the scenes he had just witnessed.

title: UP Priest Arrested For Sexually Assaulting Seven-Year-Old Boy
content: A priest has been arrested for allegedly sodomising a seven-year-old boy in a village in Uttar Pradesh's Deoria, police said on Tuesday.

title: Congress To Hold Nationwide Protest Over Decision To Rename MGNREGA
content: The Indian National Congress has announced a series of nationwide protests in response to the Central government's move to rename the MGNREGA, accusing the BJP and RSS of attempting to "dismantle rights-based welfare".

title: Nitin Nabin's Exit For BJP Chief Post Triggers Bihar Cabinet Reshuffle
content: A political development unfolded in Bihar on Tuesday as the state government swiftly redistributed key ministerial portfolios following the resignation of Nitin Nabin from the cabinet.

title: Luthra Brothers Deportation Updates: Police Get 2-Day Transit Remand Of Luthra Brothers, To Bring Them To Goa Tomorrow
content: Luthra Brothers Deportation News: Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, the two accused in Goa nightclub fire, have landed in Delhi.

title: Rahul Gandhi In Germany, Congress Issues Whip Ahead Of MGNREGA Debate
content: The bill to rename MNREGA due in parliament in a day or two, the Congress has issued a whip asking all its MPs to remain present for the next three days.

title: In Delhi Minister's Apology For Pollution, A Barb For AAP
content: Delhi Environment Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa blamed the Aam Aadmi Party for the pollution in the city and declared it is "impossible for any elected government to reduce AQI in 9-10 months".

title: India Gains Leverage In US Talks As Exports Defy Trump's Steep Tariffs
content: India's exports leapt in November in defiance of US President Donald Trump's steep tariffs, providing fresh leverage in ongoing trade talks with Washington and easing pressure on New Delhi to strike a quick deal.

title: Free Kicks And A Jersey Gift? PM Modi-Lionel Messi Meet That Did Not Happen
content: Argentinian football superstar Lionel Messi, who completed his GOAT India tour today, had agreed to meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi and had even bought a jersey for him, former Union Minister Praful Patel told NDTV's Shiv Aroor.

title: Food Regulator Asks States To Launch Drive Against Adulterated Milk Products
content: The Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI) has directed all states and Union Territories to launch a special nationwide enforcement drive to curb adulteration and misbranding of milk and milk products, including paneer and khoya.

title: Putin To Jordan Crown Prince: PM Modi's Quiet 'Car Diplomacy' With World Leaders
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Ethiopia on Tuesday for a two-day visit. Ethiopia's Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed personally received PM Modi from the Addis Ababa airport and drove him to his hotel.

title: No Fuel For Vehicles In Delhi Without Valid PUC From Thursday: Minister
content: Vehicles without a valid Pollution Under Control (PUC) certificate will not be allowed to refuel at petrol pumps in the national capital from December 18, Delhi Environment Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa said on Tuesday.

title: Gujarat Bans Sale Of Rolling Papers, Pre-Rolled Cones Citing Health Risks
content: The Gujarat government on Tuesday put a ban on the storage, sale and distribution of rolling papers as well as pre-rolled cones, widely used by tobacco smokers, citing health risks.

title: "No Stubble Burning Now, Why Is Delhi Polluted?" Bhagwant Mann's Dig At BJP
content: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Monday questioned why there is a pollution crisis in the national capital despite no farm fires now.

title: PM Modi Meets Ethiopian Counterpart Abiy Ahmed Ali, Discusses Bilateral Ties
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday met his Ethiopian counterpart Abiy Ahmed Ali here and discussed issues of bilateral and mutual interest.

title: 131 Flights Cancelled In Delhi Due To Low Visibility
content: Low visibility conditions disrupted flight operations at Delhi airport on Tuesday, leading to airlines cancelling 131 flights, a Delhi International Airport Ltd official said.

title: Baby Abandoned After Birth Gets Eaten By Stray Dogs In Odisha
content: Body parts of an abandoned newborn were recovered from the mouths of stray dogs in Odisha's Balasore district on Tuesday.

title: Class 7 Boy Dies After Wall Collapses At Government School In Tamil Nadu
content: A Class 7 boy died, and another student was injured after a wall collapsed at a government school in Tamil Nadu's Tiruvallur district.

title: Probe Agency ED's Complaint In National Herald Case Not Founded On FIR: Delhi Court
content: Taking cognisance of the ED's complaint in the National Herald case against Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi and five otherswas "impermissible in law" as it was not founded on an FIR, a Delhi court has held.

title: Trinamool Leader's Last Rites Demand After Being Marked "Dead" In Draft Roll
content: A Trinamool Congress councillor on Tuesday walked into a crematorium near Kolkata and demanded that his last rites be performed, claiming that the Election Commission listed him among the "dead" in the draft electoral rolls.

title: China's $1tn paradox: Rich factories, empty malls - Xi's growth model unravels
content: China's economic momentum is faltering as November figures show a notable dip in retail sales and manufacturing output. Additionally, fixed-asset and property investments have taken a hit, reflecting domestic struggles. With growing global barriers against China's trade surplus, the country faces an uphill battle, even as it strives to meet official growth benchmarks.

title: IPL auction 2026: KKR break bank for Green; CSK bet big on uncapped Indians
content: Uncapped Indian talent drew massive attention, with Uttar Pradesh‚Äôs 20-year-old left-arm spinner Prashant Veer and Rajasthan‚Äôs 19-year-old wicketkeeper-batter Kartik Sharma both landing lucrative Rs 14.20 crore deals with Chennai Super Kings. Having entered the auction at a base price of Rs 30 lakh each, the pair went on to become the highest-paid uncapped players in IPL auction history.

title: ‚ÄòThe Great Honour Nishan of Ethiopia‚Äô: PM Modi conferred highest civilian award in Addis Ababa
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received Ethiopia's highest civilian honour, The Great Honour Nishan of Ethiopia, during his first bilateral visit. The two nations agreed to elevate their relationship to a strategic partnership, focusing on cooperation in economy, innovation, technology, defence, and health.

title: IPL auction: How all 10 teams stack up after bidding; full list of players
content: IPL auction saw record-breaking buys as Kolkata Knight Riders secured Cameron Green for Rs 25.20 crore and Matheesha Pathirana for Rs 18 crore. Uncapped Indian talents Prashant Veer and Kartik Sharma fetched Rs 14.20 crore each for Chennai Super Kings, becoming the highest-paid uncapped players. Several other big names found new homes.

title: US visa: H-1B workers, H-4 holder to undergo social-media screening; System gets tighter
content: The US State Department has tightened visa vetting, requiring H-1B workers and their H-4 dependents to undergo social media screening. Applicants must now set all social media profiles to public for enhanced background checks, a move aimed at strengthening national security and ensuring visa eligibility.

title: 'Alcoholic's personality': Top aide makes explosive claims about Trump; calls Vance 'opportunist'
content: Chief of Staff Susie Wiles offered candid insights into President Trump's "alcoholic's personality" and Vice-President JD Vance's opportunism in a Vanity Fair article. Wiles also detailed Trump's belief in his own omnipotence and his drive for retribution, while criticizing others' handling of the Epstein files.

title: NPS rules changed! Non-government subscribers can withdraw 80% of corpus from NPS ‚Äî explained
content: NPS retirement withdrawal rules have been significantly revised, allowing non-government subscribers to withdraw up to 80% of their corpus as a lump sum. The mandatory annuity purchase requirement has been reduced to a minimum of 20%, offering greater flexibility in managing post-retirement income.

title: Donald Trump hails PM Modi as 'great friend'; calls India a key strategic partner
content: US President Donald Trump hailed Prime Minister Narendra Modi as a "great friend" and reaffirmed India's status as a key strategic partner in the Indo-Pacific. The leaders discussed ongoing trade negotiations and bilateral cooperation, underscoring a shared commitment to global peace and a free, open Indo-Pacific.

title: Croma December sale: iPhone 16 at Rs 40,990; Macbook Air M4 at Rs 55,911 & other deals
content: Croma's 'Cromtastic December Sale' is offering significant discounts on electronics from December 15, 2025, to January 4, 2026. Shoppers can find deals on smartphones like the iPhone 16 and Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 7, alongside laptops, TVs, and washing machines.

title: Lakhpati Didis: How India's SHG women are transforming lives - and politics
content: Millions of rural Indian women are transforming their lives and communities by becoming 'Lakhpati Didis,' surpassing Rs 1 lakh in annual household income through self-help groups. This initiative, backed by government schemes, fosters financial literacy, entrepreneurship, and community influence, making these women a significant political constituency. Their economic empowerment is reshaping rural India's landscape.

title: The longevity race: How far science has come in chasing immortality
content: Humanity has long been captivated by the idea of immortality, a desire to defy aging and death. While myths and literature explore this dream, science now investigates extending healthspan, not just lifespan.  Researchers are exploring cellular repair and rejuvenation, but true biological immortality remains elusive, raising profound ethical and philosophical questions about the meaning of life.

title: IPL auction 2026: Most expensive player for each team across all 10 franchises - find out
content: The IPL Auction 2026 saw record-breaking buys, with Cameron Green becoming the most expensive overseas player at Rs 25.20 crore. Chennai Super Kings dominated the uncapped market, securing Prashant Veer and Kartik Sharma for Rs 14.20 crore each. Several franchises made significant investments in key players, setting the stage for an exciting season.

title: Nvidia responds to DeepSeek report; denies claims of ‚Äòbanned‚Äô chips behind January market rout
content: Nvidia has refuted claims that Chinese AI firm DeepSeek is using smuggled, restricted Blackwell chips. The report alleged DeepSeek acquired these advanced processors, banned for export to China, to train its AI models. Nvidia stated they have no evidence of such illicit activities, emphasizing their commitment to preventing circumvention of US trade restrictions.

title: 'It is impossible ...': Delhi minister apologises for toxic air; announces big steps
content: Delhi's Environment Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa stated that reducing air pollution within 9-10 months is unrealistic, apologizing for the current smog. He blamed the previous AAP government for the pollution crisis, claiming his administration is working to fix it.

title: Mick Foley cut ties with WWE over Donald Trump‚Äôs company ties
content: WWE Hall of Famer Mick Foley is departing the company due to its perceived close ties with former President Donald Trump. Foley cited concerns over the administration's immigration policies and Trump's comments following a filmmaker's death as his breaking point. He stated he can no longer represent a company he feels "coddles a man so seemingly void of compassion."

title: Will Sidney Crosby play tonight vs Oilers? Latest Penguins update (Dec 16)
content: Pittsburgh Penguins captain Sidney Crosby is expected to play against the Edmonton Oilers tonight, a crucial factor for the team's offensive strategy. His consistent performance, marked by 19 goals and 15 assists this season, highlights his dual role as a scorer and playmaker. Crosby's leadership and on-ice intelligence are vital for Pittsburgh's success in this highly anticipated matchup.

title: Ayesha Curry admits she never expected to fall for NBA legend Stephen Curry
content: Stephen and Ayesha Curry's love story began in childhood at church, though they didn't start dating until their teenage years. Ayesha's unwavering support, even encouraging Stephen to finish his degree before the NBA draft, solidified his decision to marry her. Their enduring marriage has weathered public scrutiny, with Stephen consistently crediting his wife.

title: Bukayo Saka & Tolami Benson Net Worth 2025: Earnings, brands and lifestyle
content: Arsenal star Bukayo Saka is a financial powerhouse, with his net worth projected around $30 million by 2025, fueled by his lucrative club contract and major endorsement deals. His partner, Tolami Benson, also boasts an independent career in public relations and investments, contributing to their combined financial standing. Saka's marketability continues to soar.

title: Inside Connor McDavid‚Äôs luxury car collection: supercars, favorites and more
content: Hockey superstar Connor McDavid's impressive car collection mirrors his on-ice prowess. Featuring a diverse range from the roaring Lamborghini Hurac√°n and precise Audi R8 to the luxurious Range Rover Vogue and powerful Chevrolet Camaro ZL1, his fleet showcases speed, precision, and personality. The Porsche 911 GT2 RS stands out as his favorite, embodying his passion for high-performance engineering.

title: The Trump doctrine: How United States sees India in a China-first world
content: The Trump administration's 2025 National Security Strategy redefines global power dynamics, placing India at a critical juncture.  The document emphasizes unilateral action and self-interest, urging India to contribute more to Indo-Pacific security through initiatives like the Quad, signaling a shift towards transactional alliances.

title: Watch: 5'2 Meloni meets Mozambique's 6'8 prez; her reaction goes viral
content: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni's surprised reaction to the towering height of Mozambique President Daniel Francisco Chapo during a diplomatic meeting in Rome went viral. The significant height difference caused challenges for photographers, leading to humorous online reactions. Beyond the viral moment, the leaders discussed strengthening bilateral partnerships and cooperation in key areas like energy and agriculture.

title: Royal welcome on foreign soil: PM Modi driven by Jordan Crown Prince, Ethiopian PM
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received rare personal courtesies on his Jordan and Ethiopia visits, with top leaders personally escorting and driving him. These gestures highlight the warmth and trust in India's ties with key Global South partners, reflecting strong historical and people-to-people connections.

title: IPL auction: Auqib Nabi to Prashant Veer - top 5 expensive Indian uncapped players
content: Chennai Super Kings made history at the IPL 2026 auction, signing uncapped talents Prashant Veer and Kartik Sharma for a record Rs 14.20 crore each.  The duo's impressive T20 performances propelled them to become the most expensive uncapped players ever.  Auqib Dar also fetched a significant Rs 8.4 crore from Delhi Capitals, highlighting the fierce competition for emerging Indian talent.

title: 'Gogo paper' banned: Guj bars rolling papers, pre-rolled cones sale
content: Gujarat has banned the sale and distribution of rolling papers and pre-rolled cones, commonly known as 'Gogo paper'. The state home department cited health risks and concerns that these products are being used by youth to smoke narcotic substances. The ban, effective immediately, targets harmful substances found in the papers, aiming to curb addiction among young people.

title: Your credit report goes weekly: What RBI's new rules mean for EMIs, cards and loans
content: The Reserve Bank of India is enhancing credit reporting, moving from monthly to 15-day updates and proposing weekly reporting by July 2026. This aims to accelerate the reflection of good borrower behavior, improve fraud detection, and provide a more accurate, near real-time credit profile for consumers.

title: Rs 50cr cyber fraud empire busted: Kerala-based mastermind, 9 aides held
content: Delhi Police have cracked a major international cybercrime ring, arresting its mastermind and nine associates across three cities. This multi-state operation has uncovered frauds exceeding ‚Çπ50 crore, impacting 61 registered complaints. The syndicate employed sophisticated digital impersonation and extortion tactics, with operations spanning seven states. Authorities are working to ensure justice for all victims.

title: What is Warren Buffett‚Äôs success mantra & how to recreate it?
content: Warren Buffett's wisdom transcends finance. His approach emphasizes integrity, generosity, and unwavering optimism, even amidst challenges.  Buffett's philosophy, rooted in contentment and giving, offers profound lessons for navigating life's complexities, proving his most valuable investment might be in human connection.

title: Coimbatore: Firm owner arrested for sending parcels with abusive messages to ex-employee
content: The Coimbatore city cybercrime police arrested S Sathish Kumar, 39, of Kovaipudur, who runs a digital marketing firm in Puliyakulam in the city, based on a complaint lodged by a 30-year-old woman who worked at his firm during 2023-2024.

title: 'Lost Canadians': Ottawa reforms citizenship law; big relief for Indian-origin families
content: Canada's citizenship-by-descent rules have been overhauled, ending years of uncertainty for many families, including those of Indian origin. Bill C-3, effective December 15, 2025, removes the controversial 'first-generation limit,' allowing Canadians born abroad to pass citizenship to their children. This reform ensures fairness and clarity for transnational families, restoring rights for past generations and establishing clearer future pathways.

title: KKR Squad: Complete Kolkata Knight Riders team; full players list
content: Kolkata Knight Riders made a major impact at the IPL players' auction. They secured Australian all-rounder Cameron Green for a record Rs 25.20 crore. Sri Lankan fast bowler Matheesha Pathirana was also acquired for Rs 18 crore. These signings highlight KKR's aggressive strategy in building their squad for the upcoming season.

title: Unique gesture: Ethiopia PM drives Modi to hotel; takes unplanned detour
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Addis Ababa for a two-day State visit to Ethiopia, where he was personally received by Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed Ali. The visit aims to strengthen bilateral cooperation and reaffirm shared commitments as partners in the Global South. PM Modi will hold talks with his Ethiopian counterpart and address the Indian diaspora.

title: Will Jack Roslovic play tonight vs Penguins? Latest Oilers update
content: Jack Roslovic is expected to play for the Edmonton Oilers against the Pittsburgh Penguins tonight, providing a crucial boost to the team's center depth.  His scoring and playmaking abilities, with 10 goals and 8 assists this season, will be vital for Edmonton's offensive execution and maintaining balance in a key road matchup.

title: Lung cancer: New blood test can find cancer one cell at a time
content: Researchers have developed a groundbreaking blood test using Fourier Transform Infrared (FT-IR) microspectroscopy to detect a single lung cancer cell. This innovative technique identifies the unique chemical fingerprint of cancer cells, offering potential for earlier diagnoses, personalized treatments, and fewer invasive procedures. The findings, published in Applied Spectroscopy, could extend to other cancer types.

title: Tejasvi Dahiya: Son of school teachers, hits sixes for fun; bags Rs 3 crore KKR deal
content: Rejected at last year‚Äôs IPL auction, Tejasvi Singh Dahiya rebuilt himself under a harsh, gurukul-style training regime in Bhopal. Son of two schoolteachers and armed with a fearless batting mindset, the Delhi batter‚Äôs Rs 3 crore KKR deal now offers him a chance to turn sacrifice, discipline and six-hitting flair into an IPL breakthrough.

title: 'India should teach them lesson': Assam CM slams B'desh leaders; remarks on NE states in focus
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma issued a stern warning to Bangladesh, stating India will retaliate if Bangladeshi politicians continue to make remarks about the northeastern region. His comments followed a statement by a Bangladeshi leader suggesting isolation of India's northeast and support for separatists if India destabilizes Bangladesh.

title: 'Shocking': BJP flays Cong leader for remarks on Op Sindoor; what Chavan said
content: Former Maharashtra CM Prithviraj Chavan claimed India was "completely defeated" on the first day of Operation Sindoor, alleging Indian aircraft were shot down and the Air Force grounded. The BJP criticized his remarks, accusing the Congress of disrespecting the armed forces and undermining national security.

title: CLAT 2026 result released: Direct link to download scorecards and key details here
content: CLAT 2026 results are out. The Consortium of National Law Universities has announced CLAT 2026 results. Candidates can download their scorecards from the official CLAT website. The CLAT 2026 exam was held on December 7, 2025. The admissions counselling process has now begun for undergraduate and postgraduate law programmes. Registration for counselling is open until December 27, 2025.

title: Goa club fire case: Luthra brothers in 48-hour police custody; key points
content: Goa nightclub fire owners, Gaurav and Saurabh Luthra, were deported from Bangkok to Delhi on Tuesday morning after fleeing India hours after the December 6 blaze that killed 25. The brothers face culpable homicide and negligence charges for alleged fire safety norm violations. Their passports were cancelled and an Interpol notice issued before their detention in Thailand.

title: IPL auction 2026: Most expensive buys - from Cameron Green to Prashant Veer
content: Kolkata Knight Riders made a record-breaking Rs 25.20 crore bid for Australian all-rounder Cameron Green at the IPL 2026 auction. Uncapped Indian spinner Prashant Veer also fetched a historic Rs 14.20 crore from Chennai Super Kings, becoming the most expensive uncapped player ever. Matheesha Pathirana was also secured by KKR for Rs 18 crore.

title: Insurance bill 2025: 100% FDI, policyholder protection & more; what we know
content: A new bill, Sabka Bima Sabki Raksha, has been introduced in Parliament. This aims to transform India's insurance sector. Foreign investment limits will rise to 100 percent. New licenses for specific insurance types will be available. The goal is universal insurance coverage by 2047. This reform seeks to boost growth and policyholder protection.

title: Igor Shesterkin shows anger after Rangers‚Äô home loss to Ducks at MSG
content: The New York Rangers' problems at home continued when they lost to the Anaheim Ducks at Madison Square Garden. After the final buzzer, star goalie Igor Shesterkin clearly showed his anger. This showed how tense things were getting because the team wasn't playing well. The loss showed once more that New York has trouble scoring and problems at home.

title: Bondi beach horror: Shooter Sajid from Hyderabad; had little contact with kin in India
content: Telangana Police confirmed Sajid Akram, an accused in the Bondi Beach terror attack, is from Hyderabad, migrating to Australia 27 years ago. His radicalization had no connection to India. The attack killed 16, including a child and rabbi, with authorities investigating the duo's recent Philippines trip.

title: 'Fatherly affection': Bihar min's odd defence of CM Nitish amid Hijab row; takes shot at oppn
content: Bihar's Minority Affairs Minister Zama Khan defended Chief Minister Nitish Kumar after he removed a woman doctor's hijab during a public event. Khan described the act as fatherly affection, aiming to highlight minority women's progress. The incident sparked outrage, with the Congress demanding Kumar's resignation and questioning women's safety in the state.

title: US labour market stumbles in Nov: Unemployment rate at 4.6%; highest since 2021
content: US job growth slowed significantly in November, adding 64,000 positions, a stark contrast to October's loss. The unemployment rate climbed to 4.6%, its highest since 2021, influenced by federal workforce reductions and economic uncertainties. Businesses are hesitant to expand due to AI integration and policy unpredictability.

title: 'Thiruparankundram pillar is Jain': TN govt tells HC; cites archaeological texts
content: The Tamil Nadu government informed the Madras High Court that a stone pillar atop Thiruparankundram hill was built by Jain saints, not Hindus, citing archaeological evidence. The court is hearing appeals regarding lighting Karthigai Deepam at the pillar, with arguments also presented by a dargah's counsel challenging the pillar's designation as a lamp post.

title: What to say to your boss after making a mistake at work
content: Making mistakes at work is common. Employees often fear admitting errors, but this can lead to bigger problems. High-performing teams report mistakes early. Managers value how employees respond to errors more than the mistakes themselves. Speaking up quickly, taking clear ownership, and offering solutions are key. This approach builds trust and shows reliability.

title: Sunjay Kapur estate row: Priya opposes forensic test of will
content: A Delhi High Court hearing saw Priya Sachdev Kapur resist a forensic analysis of a Will central to the Kapur family inheritance dispute. Karisma Kapoor's side questioned Priya's narrative on company involvement, with her refusal to allow scrutiny fueling further uncertainty. The case, involving Sunjay Kapur's succession, continues.

title: Tempo reveal new uniforms ahead of inaugural season
content: the uniforms are rooted in the city, built for its fans, and crafted to reflect the Tempo's forward-driving spirit . the team's signature colors are Borealis Blue and Tempo Bordeaux . each uniform is represented in the franchise's primary logo .

title: Ranking all 64 teams in College Football Playoff history
content: the new era of college football features a larger College Football Playoff and a lower bar for inclusion . the transfer portal and increased freedom of movement for players have meant that today's best teams can't stockpile awesome backups as easily as they could in the past .

title: Which NHL teams are most at risk of a shocking playoff miss?
content: the 2025-26 season offers plenty of teams who fit that description . eight teams entered the season with relatively high playoff odds . they now find themselves most on the wrong side of the postseason bubble . we'll also identify the othelo .

title: MMA divisional rankings: Manel Kape makes a big move to close 2025
content: manel Kape defeats former title challenger Brandon Royval in the first round . the win shot Kape up the flyweight rankings and squarely into the championship picture . a fighter must have competed over the past 12 months or have a fight booked .

title: Latest AP poll: What's next for every Top 25 team?
content: the sixth in-season edition of the men's AP Top 25 poll features little movement . Arizona retains its No. 1 position, with no changes in the top 10 other than Gonzaga and Houston swapping the no. 7 and 8 spots . only one new team cracks this week's top 25 .

title: Free agent pickups: What can you do to replace Patrick Mahomes?
content: the 15th Sunday of the season featured several notable comebacks . a pair of season-ending knee injuries may define this week for both the short and long term . the qbs ranked second among all qBs in week 15 .

title: College football bowl season: MVPs for the first two bowl games of the season
content: south Carolina State beat Prairie View A&M 40‚Äì38 with a two-point conversion . it's one of the most exciting times of the year as the 2025 bowl season is underway . college football experts provide their MVP picks for each of the 36 bowl games this season .

title: Best fits for transfer quarterback DJ Lagway: Five schools that make the most sense
content: DJ Lagway is the top-rated quarterback in the 2024 ESPN 300 . he's coming off a 4-8 season in which he threw 14 interceptions and ranked 14th in the conference in QBR (59.5) but there's still a market for his talents if the 19-game starter can find the right situation and stay healthy .
